snippet: Only the pope has the authority to make the changeless church change, but it is his authority that stands in the way of change.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Garry Wills highlights paradox in which only the pope has authority to make Roman Catholic Church change, but it is exactly that authority that stands in way of change; expresses pessimism that Benedict XVI's successor will remedy discord in church.
lead_paragraph: Only the pope has the authority to make the changeless church change, but it is his authority that stands in the way of change.

headline.seo: New Pope? I’ve Given Up Hope
